column4: anyone know how to reset the xine audio subsystem without rebooting?
I don't think xine is an audio subsystem, most systems use alsa, the command to restart is "sudo /etc/init.d/alsa-utils resart" (I think)
restart even, if it isn't alsa utils, you can tab complete after alsa
how do i determine the card.  it wants the card to complete the command
it shouldn't do that, it sounds like your alsa setup may be broken or possibly you're using a different sound architecture

what happened was that I had amarok playing tunes.  I then went into a website that had a youtube video.  It had no sound so I stopped amarok and reloaded the page.  it reloaded and began playing.  then it stopped responding.  i left it alone to give the page time to respond in firefox.  firefox, after about 10 minutes began playing the video again with sound.  now I can't get amarok to play even though that page is no longer
the command states it wants the card.  jimbo@Gutsy32-X2:~$ sudo /etc/init.d/alsa-utils resart nvidia
I don't know much about the sound architecture, I just know how to restart it
wait did you put "nvidia" in you command?
that shouldn't be necessary, (the [] mean an optional argument) all I can guess is that your sound hasn't been setup properly somewhere...
I'm assuming you did try it without any argument after "restart"
i have an x-fi card in there as well that linux doesn't know what to do with.
if you open your System>Prefs>Sound you can see which sound cards are recognised

the x-fi card is not recognized under linux.  there are no 32 bit drivers for it from creative.  i just haven't taken the time to remove the card from the computer once I found out that linux does not support that card at all.
if your normal card is recognised all you should have to do is "...alsa-utils restart", if there are further problems than that, I'm not sure I can help you sorry :/

both cards are seen by linux.  lspci says the xfi card is there but it can't be used because there are no drivers.  the command that you gave matches the required syntax per their help message.  I pasted yours in instead of typing.  it doesn't reset and it gives that help text in response to issuing the command.
